link.synopsis: Acclaimed filmmaker Francis Ford Coppola breathes new life into his beloved 1983 coming-of-age tale based on the novel by S.E. Hinton. This restored version features previously unreleased footage, including a new beginning and ending; a new soundtrack (with tunes from Elvis and Van Morrison); director commentary; and remarks from cast members Matt Dillon, Ralph Macchio, C. Thomas Howell, Patrick Swayze, Rob Lowe and Diane Lane.
link.title: synopsis

title.regular: The Outsiders - The Complete Novel Extended Edition

link.synopsis: A gumshoe's frenzied efforts to win back his fiancée while dealing with Elvis impersonators galore give new meaning to the word zany in this madcap comedy. Finally ready to get hitched, reluctant bridegroom Jack Singer (Nicolas Cage) and his soon-to-be-wife, Betsy (Sarah Jessica Parker), head for Las Vegas, where Jack loses everything -- including Betsy -- to professional gambler Tommy Korman (James Caan). Anne Bancroft also stars.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Las Vegas: An Unconventional History: American Experience

link.synopsis: In 1978 Detroit, a Kiss concert was an epoch-making event. In director Adam Rifkin's riotous comedy, four teens (Giuseppe Andrews, James DeBello, Edward Furlong and Natasha Lyonne) find that getting tickets to the sold-out show becomes the focal point of their existence. They'll do anything for tickets -- compete in a strip club's amateur-night contest, take on religious protesters and even rob a convenience store!
link.title: synopsis
KISS: Kissology: The Ultimate Collection: Vol. 3: 1992-2000
Tenacious D in: The Pick of Destiny
Kiss: Symphony: Rock and Roll Over: Beethoven
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Romy and Michele's High School Reunion
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th
House Party 4: Down to the Last Minute

link.synopsis: Stand-up comedian Chris Rock takes to the stage of Harlem's fabled Apollo Theater with his raw riffs on race relations, fidelity, Bill Clinton's presidency, school violence, parental duties and more. Rock's brand of incendiary comedy takes no prisoners, and the comic makes no apologies for his frank, insightful social commentary and his demand that people take responsibility for the choices they make in life.
link.title: synopsis
Best of the Chris Rock Show: Vol. 1
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth
Best of the Chris Rock Show: Vol. 2
Inside the Actors Studio: Dave Chappelle
Why We Laugh: Black Comedians on Black Comedy
Katt Williams: The Pimp Chronicles: Pt. 1
Lewis Black: Red, White and Screwed
Jamie Foxx Unleashed: Lost, Stolen and Leaked!
George Carlin: You are All Diseased

National Lampoon Live: New Faces: Vol. 2

Lisa Lampanelli: Take It Like a Man
Carlos Mencia: The Best of "Funny Is Funny"
Lisa Lampanelli: Dirty Girl: No Protection
Jamie Foxx Presents: America's Funniest Comics: Vol. 3

link.synopsis: With Laurence Olivier playing the smoldering Mr. Darcy and Greer Garson portraying the strong-willed eldest Bennet daughter intent on landing him, the sparks fly in this lively adaptation of Jane Austen's classic novel. Maureen O'Sullivan, Ann Rutherford, Heather Angel and Marsha Hunt play the other four Bennet sisters -- all of whom their status-conscious mother (Mary Boland) is eager to marry off in this Oscar-winning comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Austen Country: The Life and Times of Jane Austen
The Love Trap / Directed by William Wyler
I Was a Male War Bride

link.synopsis: With a bump to the head, Jamal Walker (Martin Lawrence) finds himself transported from his job at a medieval theme park to the real Middle Ages, where he teams with ex-knight Sir Knolt (Tom Wilkinson) and chambermaid Victoria (Marsha Thomason) to take out the evil King Leo (Kevin Conway). The hilarity begins as Jamal clashes with Leo and his henchman, who've stolen the throne from Queen Victoria (Helen Carey) in director Gil Junger's comedy.
link.title: synopsis
What's the Worst That Could Happen?
Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me

link.synopsis: Cabbie and compulsive gambler Jay Trotter (Richard Dreyfuss) promises his long-suffering wife, Pam (Teri Garr), that he'll give up betting on the ponies -- a vow that lasts until he gets a tip on a sure thing, puts down his last $50 and wins. Before you can say "daily double," Trotter parlays his winnings into a bundle ... but how long will his hot streak last? Jennifer Tilly co-stars as a buxom ditz in this breezy comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Down and Out in Beverly Hills
Once Upon a Time in America
Bad Lieutenant: Port of Call New Orleans

link.synopsis: This refreshing teen comedy from director Michael Davis centers on college freshman Matthew (Jonathan Tucker), who finds love in a dorm elevator during a power failure -- only to miss her name, leaving him to sort through 100 ladies to locate the mystery woman. Emmanuelle Chriqui, Larisa Oleynik, Jaime Pressly, Marissa Ribisi and Katherine Heigl are among the coeds who teach Matthew about first impressions, reputations and stereotypes.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: When easy-on-the-eyes Matt Sullivan (Josh Hartnett) is dumped by his girlfriend, he swears off all sex for Lent, which lasts 40 days and 40 nights. But his abstinence is tested when he meets beautiful and sexy Erica Sutton (Shannyn Sossamon). Feeling like he's doomed if he doesn't stick to his plan, he struggles to resist the girl of his dreams. Michael Lehmann directs this feel-good comedy; Paulo Costanzo and Monet Mazur co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Call Me: The Rise and Fall of Heidi Fleiss
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
National Lampoon Presents Jake's Booty Call
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back

link.synopsis: Director Tim Story's ensemble comedy depicts a day in the life of a barbershop on Chicago's south side. A $50,000 reward offer for information about a recent heist sends the shop -- already a hub of speculation and rumor -- into a frenzy. The barbers, including Calvin (Ice Cube) and 70-year-old Eddie (Cedric the Entertainer), try to pick up clues to the crime from the haircuts they gave that day. Anthony Anderson and Eve co-star in this surprise hit.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Gary Hardwick directs this urban romantic comedy in which three young men pay a player named Ray (LL Cool J) to romance Eva (Gabrielle Union) -- their girlfriends' beautiful but bossy older sister who's been dishing out unwanted advice ever since the girls' parents passed away. But no one expected Ray to fall for Eva -- and when he does, the guys get more than they bargained for. Can Ray melt Eva's chilly heart?
link.title: synopsis
A Good Man Is Hard to Find
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: Fred Astaire and Cyd Charisse swing and sway to a luscious Cole Porter score in this musical reworking of the 1939 film Ninotchka. Fred's a producer trying to mount a movie set in Paris, and Cyd is a Soviet apparatchik sent to protect the integrity of Russia's finest composer (who's contributing tunes to Fred's film). This Cold War romantic comedy includes the sinuous standard "All of You."
link.title: synopsis

category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: I'll See You in My Dreams
The Story of Vernon & Irene Castle

link.synopsis: Pedro Almodovar's dark comedy shines in spite of its occasionally tragic story line. Gloria (Carmen Maura) is a matriarch struggling against her mean husband (Luis Hostalot), two wayward sons (one of whom is a drug dealer) and her grandmother, all of whom live with Gloria in one tiny apartment. Gloria's friendship with a prostitute, Cristal (Verónica Forqué), provides her some relief, and so does the telekinetic upstairs neighbor.
link.title: synopsis
How to be a Woman and not Die in the Attempt
Women on the Verge of a Nervous Breakdown
Tie Me Up! Tie Me Down!
De Que Se Rien Las Mujeres?
Jo Jo Dancer, Your Life is Calling

title.regular: What Have I Done to Deserve This?
title.short: What Have I Done to Deserve This?

link.synopsis: Television's "King of Queens" reigns again in this Comedy Central special -- the network's first-ever hour-long show devoted entirely to one comic, taped live in July 2001 at New York City's Hudson Theatre. James riffs on life's many "royal" pains, including waiting in line with strangers, negotiating with the airport ticket counter clerk, underwear wedgies, boringly slow answering machine messages and more.

link.synopsis: Long before "Sanford and Son" turned Redd Foxx into a household name, he gained notoriety with his raunchy stand-up comedy act. Filmed at the Silverbird Hotel in Las Vegas, this HBO special features the foulmouthed funnyman at his uncensored best.

Robin Harris: Live from the Comedy Act Theater
Platinum Comedy Series: Sheryl Underwood: Too Much Information
Platinum Comedy Series: The Good, The Badd, The Funny

Monty Python's And Now for Something Completely Different

link.synopsis: Comedian Bill Maher leaves no target unturned in this hilarious collection of bits from his HBO series "Real Time with Bill Maher." Stamping his trademark wit on the inherent comedy of actual events, Maher attacks the things that drive him crazy. Bonus features include a live round of Maher's signature on-camera "editorials," in which he sounds off on politics, pop culture and everything in between.
link.title: synopsis
Bill Maher: Victory Begins at Home
The Awful Truth with Michael Moore
Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America: A Final Night with George W. Bush
Assume the Position with Mr. Wuhl

Queer Eye for the Straight Guy: Kyan and Jai ... Looking Good

link.synopsis: This quirky family comedy stars Rodney Dangerfield as Chester Lee, an ambitious salesman who volunteers to coach his company's all-girl soccer squad -- the Ladybugs -- to curry favor with his boss (Tom Parks). But the talentless team is in danger of losing every game until Chester presses his fiancée's jock son, Matthew (Jonathan Brandis), into service ... as a soccer phenom named Martha. The supporting cast includes Ilene Graff and Jackee Harry.
link.title: synopsis
Rodney Dangerfield: No Respect: The Ultimate Collection
A Nightmare Come True / Two Came Back

link.synopsis: After exiling himself from polite society, erstwhile lawyer Godfrey Smith (David Niven) gets the chance to make good when an eccentric heiress (June Allyson) offers him a job as her household's butler. Turns out, with his polish, panache and impeccable manners -- not to mention copious common sense -- Godfrey is a godsend to the chaotic clan. Niven earned a Golden Globe nomination for his role in this remake of the 1936 comedy of the same name.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Thank You, Jeeves / Step Lively, Jeeves!
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
I Was a Male War Bride
You Can't Take It with You

link.synopsis: An aging boxer (Adam Carolla) turned construction worker dons his gloves again two decades after stepping away from the ring in a bid to win the prize he had been unable to attain before, a berth on the U.S. Olympic Boxing Team. Years past his prime, the onetime up-and-comer struggles in the ring and out as the boxing establishment doubts he can pull off a comeback in this sly comedy from director Charles Herman-Wurmfeld.
link.title: synopsis
Where in the World Is Osama Bin Laden?
The Kid Stays in the Picture
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
Joe Rogan: Talking Monkeys in Space
Gabriel Iglesias: I'm Not Fat ... I'm Fluffy

link.synopsis: Foul-mouthed Australian comedian Jim Jeffries puts everything out there in this raunchy HBO comedy special that marks his full-length solo debut -- and shows off his skill for skewering sacred cows with brutal honesty. Over the course of a no-holds-barred evening during which no subject is safe, Jeffries dissects double standards when it comes to women, men and sex, and explains why being a slut is easier than being a stud.
link.title: synopsis
Joe Rogan: Talking Monkeys in Space
Richard Jeni: A Big Steaming Pile of Me
Ricky Gervais: Out of England: The Stand-Up Special

Lost Reality 2: More of the Worst

title.regular: Jim Jefferies: I Swear to God
title.short: Jim Jefferies: I Swear to God

link.synopsis: As he comes to grips with his undeniable attraction to big, hairy men and adjusts to his new roomies, cute cub Tyler (Joe Conti) struggles to figure out his place within the tight-knit bear community, gain acceptance from his old friends and find fuzzy love. Full of hot hookups and hilarious mishaps, this quirky romantic comedy co-stars Gerald McCullouch as Roger, the stud who catches Tyler's eye.
link.title: synopsis
Everything You Wanted to Know About Gay Porn Stars
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green

link.synopsis: An overambitious Indian ladies' man meets his match in this modern Hindi romantic comedy, when three women he's been conning wise up to his schemes. To pay him back in kind, the women devise a crafty trap for their energetic Lothario.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Teenage runaway Dennie (Sally Field) returns to her parents' home after spending a year living with hippies. Her image-conscious mother (Eleanor Parker) and father (Jackie Cooper) struggle to understand her and her younger sister (Lane Bradbury), who has recently started to rebel. While trying to overcome her parents' judgmental attitudes, Dennie attempts to point her sister in the right direction.
link.title: synopsis
Pat Garrett and Billy the Kid

title.regular: Maybe I'll Come Home in the Spring
title.short: Maybe I'll Come Home in the Spring

link.synopsis:
In the not-too-distant future, mankind has populated the moon and built vast domed cities. But when power-mad Emperor Omus (Jack Palance) attacks the lunar colony of New Washington, a team of scientists led by Dr. John Caball (Barry Morse) launches a dangerous mission to destroy the dictator and his robot army.
Carol Lynley, Nicholas Campbell and John Ireland co-star in this sci-fi adventure inspired by H.G. Wells's visionary novel.
link.title: synopsis
Voyage to the Planet of Prehistoric Women
Drive-in Double Feature: Creation of the Humanoids / War Between the Planets
Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country
Star Trek III: The Search for Spock
Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home
Battle for the Planet of the Apes
Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan
Star Wars: Episode IV: A New Hope
Star Trek V: The Final Frontier

title.regular: The Shape of Things to Come
title.short: The Shape of Things to Come

link.synopsis: Goldie Hawn shines as gentle librarian Gloria Mundy, who finds her peaceful and slightly boring existence shaken when she uncovers a plan to assassinate the Pope in this action-comedy inspired by Alfred Hitchcock thrillers. Fearing for her life, Gloria elicits the help of local cop, Tony Carlson (Chevy Chase), who's game enough to take on the strange case. Good thing, too, as matters morph from odd to bizarre and love blooms between the two.
link.title: synopsis

link.title: The Private Life of Sherlock Holmes

link.synopsis: When their wives die on the same day in the same hospital room, two aging British World War II vets -- upper-crust Reggie (Albert Finney) and retired milkman Roy (Tom Courtenay, in a BAFTA-winning performance) -- become unlikely roommates in Reggie's mansion. Their friendship blossoms until gold-digging Liz (Joanna Lumley) enters the picture with her sights set on Reggie in this beautifully acted Masterpiece Theatre comedy-drama.
link.title: synopsis
When Did You Last See Your Father?
Anna and the King of Siam

link.synopsis: This comedy-plus-music remake of Preston Sturges's Miracle of Morgan's Creek stars Jerry Lewis and features an unlikely but engaging plot. Lewis plays a doofus TV repairman whose former girlfriend has become a movie star and now needs his help.
link.title: synopsis
There's No Business Like Show Business
Three Men and a Little Lady
The Adventures of Ma & Pa Kettle: Vol. 1
Don't Raise the Bridge, Lower the River
Martin & Lewis: At War with the Army
Jayne Mansfield Collection: Will Success Spoil Rock Hunter?
Dean Martin & Jerry Lewis: Vol. 3: Still Laughing
The 2006 Academy Award Short Films Collection

link.synopsis: After getting locked overnight in a walk-in freezer, frigid fast-food restaurant manager Fiona (Fiona Gordon) makes a chilling discovery: Her husband and two kids didn't even realize she was missing. She soon becomes obsessed with all things cold and icy, eventually deciding to take a surprise journey to a real iceberg. Gordon won the Audience Award for Best Actress at the Seattle Film Festival in this quirky, deadpan Belgian comedy.
link.title: synopsis
How Much Do You Love Me?

link.synopsis: Don Swan (Mark Hamill) attends a comic book convention (Comic-con in San Diego, Calif.) to film a documentary featurette about a popular comic book that looks to break out and become a major movie blockbuster. But the studio doesn't know that Swan is obsessed with the comic book and has his own peculiar plans for the documentary. Bruce Campbell, Stan Lee, Kevin Smith and a host of others make cameo appearances.
link.title: synopsis
This Film Is Not Yet Rated
Nightmares in Red, White and Blue
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Starz Inside: Anime: Drawing A Revolution
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels
OMG! The Top 50 Incidents in WWE History
Inferno: The Making of the Expendables

link.synopsis: An aging nymphomaniac (Beryl Reid) and her closeted gay brother (Harry Andrews) both become enamored with Sloane (Peter McEnery), a handsome young man with a shady past. When Sloane kills their father (Alan Webb), the siblings overlook his offense and blackmail him into satisfying their outlandish desires. Based upon a play by Joe Orton, this black comedy maintains a gleeful tone while exploring homicide, sadism and homosexuality.
link.title: synopsis
The Best of Boys in Love

link.synopsis: Vincent Price returns as Dr. Goldfoot in this sequel to the hit Bond parody Dr. Goldfoot and the Bikini Machine. But as the first film was a huge success in Italy, production on the follow-up moved there, with horror maestro Mario Brava directing. Hoping to cause worldwide chaos, "Dr. G" develops an army of walking, talking, scantily clad robot women that explode when you touch their belly buttons. Italian comedy partners Franco and Ciccio co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Dr. Goldfoot and the Bikini Machine
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
Don't Worry, We'll Think of a Title

title.short: Dr. Goldfoot and the Girl Bombs

link.synopsis: Witness the talent and creativity of British prog-rock band the Enid with this special concert program, which features the group playing both an intimate set at their home studio in Claret Hall Farm and a bigger show at the Stonehenge Free Festival. Recorded in 1984, both Enid performances draw heavily on enjoyable material from the group's incredibly successful record "Something Wicked This Way Comes."

link.synopsis: Troy Sneed produces this performance by a choir of 350 children, all members of a group known as Youth for Christ, as they sing an eclectic mix of hymns and modern pop-style songs, each of which is a tribute to God.  Included in the concert are tunes such as "There's Not a Friend," featuring Michael A. Young; "I Can't Forget," featuring the Rev. Milton Biggham; "I Give You Praise," featuring Troy Sneed and  many more.

link.synopsis: Curious George, the mischief-making monkey made famous through the classic children's books by Margret and H.A. Rey, springs to life in this animated adventure detailing his journey from the jungles of Africa to the shores of America accompanied by the Man in the Big Yellow Hat. This program also includes animated versions of Arnold Lobel's classic children's books Frog and Toad Together and Frog and Toad Are Friends.

link.synopsis: In this award-winning children's program, legendary composer Johann Sebastian Bach drops into the modern world with a magical orchestra and choir in tow to inspire a reluctant young piano student named Elizabeth. Musical selections include "Jesu, Joy of Man's Desiring," Air for the G String and the Brandenberg concertos, as well as several lesser-known pieces that Bach wrote especially for children.

Wonder Pets!: Save the Nursery Rhyme!

Barney: Once Upon a Dino Tale

link.synopsis: Henry Hubchen stars as the titular Jaeckie Zucker in this entertaining German comedy from director Dani Levy. A former sportscaster turned pool hustler, the down-on-his-luck Jaeckie finds himself facing a mounting stack of debts -- and jail time, to boot. But when his mother suddenly passes away, Jaeckie stands to inherit a fortune -- that is, if he can reconcile with his uptight, humorless brother (Udo Samel) for a week.
link.title: synopsis
As Far as My Feet Will Carry Me

link.synopsis: Mirroring Poland's nonsensical political climate in the 1970s, this slapstick comedy follows the efforts of a troubled businessman (Krzysztof Kowalewski) to prove his wife's (Ewa Wisniewska) infidelity with incriminating photographs. Trouble is, she's never committed adultery. But since &NFi;he&NFi_; has -- going so far as to accidentally impregnate another woman -- he decides to deflect the blame from himself and point the finger at his guiltless spouse.
link.title: synopsis
Jak Rozpetalem II Wojne Swiatowa I
Jak Rozpetalem II Wojne Swiatowa II
A Year of the Quiet Sun

title.regular: Co Mi Zrobisz Jak Mnie Zlapiesz
title.short: Co Mi Zrobisz Jak Mnie Zlapiesz

link.synopsis: This rollicking Western follows the comedic exploits of two dueling twin brothers (Jim Dale, in a dual role) with very different occupations -- one is a harsh gunslinger, and the other is a humble employee of the Salvation Army. Together, the twins take part in a string of outlandish competitions to see who will take home a large inheritance and thus rule the tiny town. Don Knotts, Karen Valentine and Darren McGavin co-star in this Disney comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Now You See Him, Now You Don't
The Apple Dumpling Gang Rides Again
The Strongest Man in the World
The Horse in the Gray Flannel Suit
The Last Flight of Noah's Ark
Rainbow Brite and the Star Stealer
The Care Bears Movie II: A New Generation
The One and Only, Genuine, Original Family Band
The New Adventures of Pippi Longstocking
Wallace & Gromit: The Curse of the Were-Rabbit

link.synopsis: Two aspiring actresses -- refined Lauren (Shelley Long) and brassy Sandy (Bette Midler) -- seem to have nothing in common, until they learn they share the same boyfriend (Peter Coyote). When he mysteriously disappears, the ladies embark on a wacky cross-country pursuit to track him down.Will these wronged women find the philandering scoundrel -- and justice? Comedian George Carlin co-stars in this fast-paced comedy of errors.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Down and Out in Beverly Hills
See No Evil, Hear No Evil
The Man with One Red Shoe

link.synopsis: Roberta (Rosanna Arquette) seeks vicarious thrills through other people's personal ads. But via a jacket, amnesia and mistaken identity, Roberta comes to believe she's Susan (Madonna), a wild Soho vamp wanted by the mob. Dez (Aidan Quinn) falls for "Susan" (Roberta); the real Susan has no idea she has a double; and Roberta's husband, Jim (Mark Blum), is thrown for a loop. Director Susan Seidelman's romantic comedy features tons of cameos.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: The Man with One Red Shoe
Madonna: I'm Going to Tell You a Secret

link.synopsis: With a sun-burnished Aegean isle as a backdrop, this breezy, escapist comedy (which won an Oscar for Best Foreign Language Film) follows eight misfit Italian soldiers dispatched to defend the remote island during World War II. Next thing you know, the garrison ends up stranded on the seemingly deserted paradise. When the men discover the island's many charms -- including its preponderantly female population -- their fighting spirit melts away.
link.title: synopsis
The Night of the Shooting Stars
The Story of a Three-Day Pass
The Loves and Times of Scaramouche

link.synopsis: Elliot (Paul Mercurio) goes to a sex resort on the island of Eden to live out his submissive fantasies, but doesn't realize diamond smugglers and two detectives (Rosie O'Donnell and Dan Aykroyd) are tailing him because he possesses the only existing photographs of the smugglers at work. Things are complicated further after Elliot falls in love with dominatrix Lisa (Dana Delany), the headmistress of the island, in this dark comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
The Incredibly True Adventure of 2 Girls in Love

link.synopsis: Pauly Shore and Stephen Baldwin star in this guilty pleasure: a comedy that requires no thought but generates a lot of laughs. Slackers Bud and Doyle mistakenly get sucked into living inside the Bio-Dome -- an environmental experiment that requires residents to stay for a year without outside contact. Can Bud and Doyle save the world, or will the world have to be saved from Bud and Doyle?
link.title: synopsis
Pauly Shore's Natural Born Komics Sketch Comedy Movie: Miami
Don't Tell Mom the Babysitter's Dead
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery

link.synopsis: Jacques Tati plays Monsieur Hulot, a self-absorbed chucklehead wrestling with neoteric gadgetry -- and losing -- in this satirical masterpiece that makes sport of mechanization, class distinctions and modernity. While visiting his sister's surreal, ultra-trendy home, Hulot finds himself incessantly at odds with newfangled contraptions that get the better of him. The tongue-in-cheek French comedy garnered a Best Foreign Language Film Oscar.
link.title: synopsis
Brigitte and Brigitte / Up and Down: The Films of Luc Moullet
The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie
2 or 3 Things I Know About Her

link.synopsis: A $20 bill provides a unique perspective as it wends its way through the various strata of America's classes, providing an up-close-and-personal look at our society and the American experience. Among the characters who latch onto the "dead president" are a thief, a stripper and a grandmother. Christopher Lloyd, Diane Baker, Steve Buscemi, Linda Hunt and Elisabeth Shue star in this Capra-esque comedy directed by Keva Rosenfeld.
link.title: synopsis
The Six Wives of Henry Lefay
Journey to the End of the Night
A Thousand Years of Good Prayers

link.synopsis: The gonzo cadets from everyone's favorite police academy jet off to Moscow to help the Russians deal with the Mafia. This seventh sequel in the hit comedy series stars Charlie Schlatter, Christopher Lee, Claire Forlani, David Graf, G.W. Bailey, Leslie Easterbrook, Michael Winslow, Pamela Guest, Richard Israel and Ron Perlman. Can you say &NFi;nyet&NFi_;-wits?
link.title: synopsis
Revenge of the Nerds 2: Nerds in Paradise
Revenge of the Nerds III: The Next Generation
Revenge of the Nerds IV: Nerds in Love
The Dukes of Hazzard: The Beginning
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
The Longshot / They Went That-A-Way & That-A-Way
Naked Gun 2 1/2: The Smell of Fear

link.synopsis: Comedy duo Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis come together for the first time in this slapstick-heavy feature. Vic Puccinelli (Martin) and Alvin Korwin (Lewis) are buddies who join the army and subsequently find themselves knee-deep in mischief at boot camp. Puccinelli is promoted to first sergeant, while Korwin's career stalls due to his endless clumsiness. Meanwhile, Puccinelli begins to romance Helen (Polly Bergen), a beautiful young local.
link.title: synopsis
My Friend Irma / My Friend Irma Goes West
Dean Martin & Jerry Lewis: Vol. 2: When Television Was Funny
The Best of Abbott and Costello: Vol. 3
Beach Blanket Bingo / How to Stuff a Wild Bikini
The Shakiest Gun in the West / The Love God?: Double Feature
Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour: The Best of Season 2
The Three Stooges: All the World's a Stooge
The Last Time I Saw Archie
I Was a Male War Bride
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: The Bank Dick

title.regular: Martin & Lewis: At War with the Army
title.short: Martin & Lewis: At War with the Army

link.synopsis: Sandra Dee stars as the irrepressible Gidget in this charming 1959 comedy that spawned a series of teen films in the early '60s. School's out for summer, and the spunky California beach girl is determined to hone her surfing skills. Along the way, she falls in love with not one but two surfer boys -- one of whom (Moondoggie, played by James Darren) could become her lasting love. Cliff Robertson co-stars as beach bum Big Kahuna.
link.title: synopsis
Tammy Tell Me True / Tammy and the Doctor
Gidget Goes Hawaiian / Gidget Goes to Rome
Beach Blanket Bingo / How to Stuff a Wild Bikini
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend

link.synopsis: College frosh Steven Karp (Jay Baruchel) tries to put his geeky high school years behind him in this comedy series created by Judd Apatow that stars Seth Rogan as Steven's beer-swilling buddy and features A-list guest stars from Adam Sandler to Will Ferrell. The plot follows Steven, his roommates and their friends as they navigate their first year away from home and learn to lean on one another when life gets confusing.
link.title: synopsis
Undeclared: The Complete Series: Disc 4: Bonus Material
Andy Richter Controls the Universe: The Complete Series
Life as We Know It: The Complete Series
Masterpiece Mystery!: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries: For the Sake of Elena

link.synopsis: Taking a hiatus from his touring gigs with the "Blue Collar Comedy Tour," Larry the Cable Guy stars in his own feature-length film, following the efforts of a restaurant health inspector to acclimate to local tastes.
link.title: synopsis
Larry the Cable Guy: Morning Constitutions
Larry the Cable Guy: Tailgate Party
Blue Collar Comedy Tour Rides Again
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: One for the Road
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Working Class Comics
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Movie
Jeff Foxworthy: You Might Be a Redneck / Check Your Neck
Ron White: You Can't Fix Stupid
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
National Lampoon Presents Jake's Booty Call
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
Bucky Larson: Born to be a Star
Balls Out: Gary the Tennis Coach
Big Mommas: Like Father, Like Son
Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery

title.regular: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
title.short: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector

link.synopsis: When her Aunt Ina (Linda Dano) orders her to find a suitable escort for a wedding that's just four weeks away, harried book editor Jane Grant (Charisma Carpenter) is forced to take a crash course in dating etiquette. But some of the Mr. Maybes she meets (including "Joe Millionaire" Evan Marriott) turn out to be Mr. Absolutely Nots. This made-for-television romantic comedy is based on Melissa Senate's novel by the same name.
link.title: synopsis
Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
I Love You, Don't Touch Me

link.synopsis: Ethan Green (Daniel Letterle) has no problem finding guys who want to sleep with him or even date him, but finding someone to settle down with is another story. Given three choices, will he find a Mr. Right, or is he destined to an unfabulous existence? He'll choose from a sexy teenager, a hunky jock or his ex-boyfriend who's about to get married George Bamber directs this comedy based on a popular gay-themed comic strip.
link.title: synopsis
Another Gay Sequel: Gays Gone Wild!
Eating Out: All You Can Eat
Karen Williams: I Need a Snack

title.regular: The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
title.short: Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green

link.synopsis: Bloated Hollywood egos and 1980s excess are personified in director Charles Shyer's industry-mocking yet heartfelt comedy starring Drew Barrymore as 10-year-old Casey Brodsky, who pursues a divorce from her famous, self-absorbed screenwriter parents. Ryan O'Neal and Shelley Long play Barrymore's oblivious, career-conscious mom and dad, whose escalating feud leaves their neglected daughter caught between them.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee

link.title: Perry Mason: The Case of the Lady in the Lake
Love and Death on Long Island
The Prize Winner of Defiance, Ohio

link.synopsis: Actor Justin Theroux makes his directorial debut with this romantic comedy about a misogynistic and largely disagreeable children's author (Billy Crudup) who's forced to work with a female illustrator (Mandy Moore) when his regular collaborator -- and only friend (Tom Wilkinson) -- falls ill. Also included in the star-studded cast are Peter Bogdanovich, Amy Sedaris, Dianne Wiest, Bob Balaban and Bobby Cannavale.
link.title: synopsis
I Could Never Be Your Woman
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: Tired of the unsatisfying singles scene, Glenn (Matthew Montgomery) answers a personal ad and meets Adam (Windham Beacham), a handsome Southern man seeking a long-term relationship. The two hit it off immediately, but their initial attraction is soon put to the test. Glenn's gay friends say he'd be happier playing the field again, but his straight pals encourage him to work at the budding relationship in director Rob Williams's romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
The Incredibly True Adventure of 2 Girls in Love

link.synopsis: In a snowy Alpine village, Claus (Claus Obalski) and Stefan (Ekkehardt Belle) are both in love with the gorgeous Eva (Sabine Wollin). But when the beauty inherits a taxi and fast-food business in the Far East, she takes her two would-be suitors on the adventure of a lifetime. This sexy German comedy from 1979 provides naughty fun and a hip soundtrack featuring the Euro-pop hit "Dschinghis Khan" by the band of the same name.
link.title: synopsis
The Virgo, The Taurus and The Capricorn
Schoolgirl Report: Vol. 5: What All Parents Should Know
The Loves and Times of Scaramouche
The Other Side of the Bed

link.synopsis: After Adam (Gary Lundy) accidentally reveals the location of the senior skip day party to Principal Dickwalder (Larry Miller), he immediately becomes the most hated guy at school. Now, the only way for Adam to redeem himself is to throw an incredible bash himself. If Adam can find booze, hot women and a gigantic gravity bong, he just might be able to repair his pitiful social life. Lea Thompson and Tara Reid co-star in this raunchy teen comedy.
link.title: synopsis
National Lampoon Presents: One, Two, Many
Van Wilder 2: The Rise of Taj
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
American Pie Presents: The Naked Mile
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th
House Party 4: Down to the Last Minute
American Pie Presents: The Book of Love

link.synopsis: Small-town bait shop owner Bill (Bill Engvall) needs $15K fast if he wants to keep his doors open, so he chases a new catch: the grand prize of an annual bass tournament. But he'll have to out-angle Hot Rod Johnson (Billy Ray Cyrus), the big-shot owner of a rival bait store. It's an upstream swim for Bill, who badly loses the competition every year. Vincent Martella also stars in this blue-collar comedy sure to have the whole family reeling.
link.title: synopsis
Shaw Grigsby: Sight Fishing for Clearwater Bass
Redneck Adventures Television Show: Jug Fishin' Made Simple
Bass Fishing: The Basics with Chuck Woolery
Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
Bill Engvall: A Decade of Laughs
Shaw Grigsby: Big Bass Fishing Tips
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Next Generation
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Movie
Blue Collar Comedy Tour Rides Again
Big Mommas: Like Father, Like Son
The Bad News Bears in Breaking Training

link.synopsis: After her latest movie bombs at the box office and she discovers that her crooked accountant has robbed her blind, spoiled Hollywood starlet Megan Valentine (Jessica Simpson) impulsively decides to enlist in the U.S. Army. Now, the pampered princess must channel her inner solider in order to make it through basic training. Director Steve Miner's lighthearted comedy also stars Steve Guttenberg, Cheri Oteri and Vivica A. Fox.
link.title: synopsis
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
Martin & Lewis: At War with the Army

link.synopsis: About to lose his ranch to foreclosure, ex-bounty hunter Tommy (Tommy Hill) comes out of retirement hoping to collect a big payday. During his perilous quest, he encounters serious trouble with a murderous bandit and one of the most wicked men (Robert Graham) in the West. Shot on location in Texas, director Scott Perry's old-fashioned Western combines romance, lighthearted comedy and intense shoot-outs.
link.title: synopsis
American Bandits: Frank and Jesse James
Shoot First and Pray You Live
The Gambler, the Girl and the Gunslinger
The Chronicles of Riddick: Dark Fury

link.synopsis: This award-winning black comedy follows the family of Nora (Silvia Mariscal), who carefully plans her suicide so that her assortment of estranged relatives, including ex-husband Jos (Fernando Lujn), will have to celebrate Passover together and hopefully achieve a reconciliation. As Jos battles with unsympathetic cemeteries, a fractious rabbi and his devoted assistant, and his own son (Ari Brickman), he realizes how deeply he still loved Nora.
link.title: synopsis
Page One: Inside the New York Times
El Coronel No Tiene Quien Le Escriba

link.synopsis: While hawking "socks for God" in a podunk Arkansas town, a pair of small-time swindlers posing as holy men (Bob Hoskins and Antonio Banderas) become embroiled in a local drama involving a rising serial killer known as "the White River Kid" (Wes Bentley). Ellen Barkin, Randy Travis, Swoosie Kurtz, Beau Bridges and former "first brother" Roger Clinton co-star in this comedy of unconventional characters, based on the book by John Fergus Ryan.
link.title: synopsis
The Favor, the Watch and the Very Big Fish
Tie Me Up! Tie Me Down!

link.synopsis: This collection contains three of George Burns and Gracie Allen's magnificent 1930s comedies. Here Comes Cookie finds Allen inheriting a large sum of money and turning her family mansion into a vaudeville theater. In Love in Bloom, Burns and Allen are traveling carnival performers working in a rundown tent show. In Six of a Kind, Burns and Allen join another couple on a cross-country motor trip that gets more zany at every turn.
link.title: synopsis
The George Burns & Gracie Allen Show
The Big Broadcast of 1938 / College Swing
The Man on the Flying Trapeze
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: It's a Gift
Deanna Durbin: Three Smart Girls / Something in the Wind
That Wonderful Urge / Love Is News
I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
If You Could Only Cook / Too Many Husbands
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: International House
Rhythm on the Range / Rhythm on the River: Double Feature
You Can't Take It with You

title.regular: Here Comes Cookie / Love in Bloom / Six of a Kind: Triple Feature
title.short: Here Comes Cookie / Love in Bloom

link.synopsis: Hustling money wherever he can to support his $100-a-day heroin habit, ex-hairdresser J (George Segal) meets the lovely Parm (Karen Black) while trying to steal her car. Fascinated by J's unpredictable street lifestyle, Parm starts joining him on his errands. Marking the American debut of Czech émigré director Ivan Passer, this grimly ironic comedy is a gritty portrait of addiction as well as an unvarnished rendering of early-1970s New York City.
link.title: synopsis
William S. Burroughs: A Man Within

link.synopsis: This wacky romantic comedy finds theater mogul Scott Raymond (Jack Watling) challenging psychiatrist Dr. Malcolm Nettel's (John Bentley) claim that he can create a "perfect" child by hypnotizing the soon-to-give-birth mother beforehand. Once the bet is in motion, Raymond convinces an actress to impersonate a pregnant woman, thus ensuring that the result goes his way. Unfortunately, the woman falls for the doc, which considerably changes the game.
link.title: synopsis
I Was a Male War Bride
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend

link.synopsis: This late-night sketch comedy series on HBO -- starring funnymen Bob Odenkirk and David Cross -- is a breath of fresh air for those seeking big laughs, terrific ingenuity and a touch of good-natured insanity. Featured in Season 2 are skits about the "new KKK," a film about coupons and a massive Broadway failure called "Jeepers Creepers," as well as an episode entitled "If You're Going to Write a Comedy Scene, You're Going To Have Rat Feces in There."
link.title: synopsis
Tim & Eric Awesome Show, Great Job!
Dr. Katz: Professional Therapist: The Complete Series
Not Just the Best of the Larry Sanders Show
Best of the Chris Rock Show: Vol. 1
Best of the Chris Rock Show: Vol. 2
The Man Show Boy / Household Hints from Adult Film Stars
Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge: The Complete Series
The Best of So Graham Norton
The Man Show Presents: Girls on Trampolines
Tracey Ullman's State of the Union
The Passion of Greg the Bunny: Best of the Film Parodies: Vol. 2
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Mike Myers
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Dana Carvey
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Chris Rock
Red Green's: We Can't Help It -- We're Men

link.synopsis: This action-packed comedy begins as small-time crook Jason Valentine (Justin Capaz) heads to jail and uses his one phone call to dial a random number. With this roll of the dice, the lives of five strangers converge in one crazy night in small-town Florida. A lovely lost soul, a female bounty hunter, a charming black-belt assassin and a mime join Jason in this wild ride from writer-director Philip Cruz.
link.title: synopsis
Aileen: Life and Death of a Serial Killer
Once Upon a Time in Cuba
The Butcher, the Chef and the Swordsman

link.synopsis: This indie film garnered awards on the festival circuit, including Slamdance, Zombiedance, the Fargo Film Festival and the Santa Cruz Film Festival. The far-out story has Jesus finally returning to Earth -- but he must contend with a world under assault by a band of vampires. Mary Magnum and the god of Mexican wrestling, El Santos, help Jesus fight evil in this oddball horror-comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Harry Knuckles and the Pearl Necklace
Otto; or, Up With Dead People
Poultrygeist: Night of the Chicken Dead
Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Movie
South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut
The Glamorous Life of Sachiko Hanai
Citizen Toxie: The Toxic Avenger IV

link.synopsis: Diana (Claudia Koll) and Paolo (Paolo Lanza) are married, but that doesn't mean they're monogamous, an arrangement that works fine until one of Diana's lovers becomes obsessed with her. A jealous Paolo rejects Diana, who then indulges in even more promiscuous behavior. The grandson of Italian painter Italico Brass, director Tinto Brass uses film as his canvas, specializing in erotic comedies like this one that takes its name from a Mozart opera.
link.title: synopsis
Schoolgirl Report: Vol. 6: What Parents Would Gladly Hush Up
Don't Let Me Die on a Sunday
The Decline of the American Empire

link.synopsis: Eric Bishop (Steve Evets) is a soccer-loving Manchester postman on the brink of a nervous breakdown. With his work life and love life in shambles, Eric seeks advice from his hero, the famously philosophical Manchester United star Eric Cantona (playing himself). The sports comedy-drama -- in competition at the 2009 Cannes Film Festival -- comes courtesy of master British director Ken Loach.
link.title: synopsis
The Art of Soccer with John Cleese
Casino Jack and the United States of Money
In the Hands of the Gods
The Wind That Shakes the Barley

link.synopsis: Timothy Dunphy (Shawn Hatosy) must deal with a broken home, a three-legged dog and a full-blown attraction to trouble. But when his dad enrolls him in prep school, things get even worse! You might half-expect a gross-out comedy from a Farrelly Brother (Dumb and Dumber, There's Something About Mary), but Outside Providence (adapted from Peter Farrelly's debut novel) is funny and thoughtful, with touches of 1970s nostalgia.
link.title: synopsis
Empire Records: Remix! Special Fan Edition
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
So I Married an Axe Murderer
Dead Like Me: Life After Death

link.synopsis: In this third installment of the hilarious comedy, rappers Kid 'n Play (respectively, Christopher Reid and Christopher Martin) pull out all the stops for one last hurrah. Before Kid can say "I do," Play wants to throw him the biggest, baddest bachelor party ever -- much to the disappointment of Kid's bride-to-be (Angela Means). The all-star supporting cast includes rhythm-and-blues supergroup TLC, Chris Rock, Gilbert Gottfried and Bernie Mac.
link.title: synopsis
House Party 4: Down to the Last Minute
NBA Hardwood Classics: Charles Barkley: Sir Charles
Revenge of the Nerds IV: Nerds in Love

link.synopsis: When an army of aliens invades Earth intending to sell humans as intergalactic hamburger meat, the New Zealand government calls in an elite team of psychotic assassins. But are these boys brutal enough to tackle the vilest villains in the universe? From director Peter Jackson (Lord of the Rings), it's the ultimate battle of flying guts, splattering brains, exploding sheep and guzzling vomit, and is a favorite for horror comedy fans.
link.title: synopsis
Poultrygeist: Night of the Chicken Dead

link.synopsis: In this British comedy, a pop star has-been (Craig Ferguson) discovers he has a teenage daughter -- the fruit of a long-forgotten weekend tryst -- living in Wales and latches on to fatherhood as a way to pull his life together. The plot thickens when he finally meets the girl (played by Charlotte Church, a famous singer in real life) and realizes she's inherited his musical genes and is poised for fame herself.
link.title: synopsis
Craig Ferguson: A Wee Bit o' Revolution
The Dirt Detective: A History of Scotland
Charlotte Church: Prelude: The Best of Charlotte Church
Charlotte Church: Enchantment from Cardiff, Wales
Andrew Lloyd Webber: The Royal Albert Hall Celebration
Bring It On: Fight to the Finish

link.synopsis: Lawrence Kasdan directed this comedy based on an improbably true story about a philandering husband, Joey (Kevin Kline), whose long-suffering wife, Rosalie (Tracey Ullman), finally uncovers his lies. She decides the only way to deal with the situation is to murder him; trouble is, he's literally difficult to kill, as he dodges one attempt after another! Will she eventually succeed, or will love conquer all in the end?
link.title: synopsis
A Night in the Life of Jimmy Reardon

link.synopsis: This vintage slapstick comedy stars Don Knotts as Hollis Figg, a nerdy municipal number-cruncher who finds himself framed as the fall guy by corrupt politicians trying to cover up their sticky-fingered high jinks with the city coffers. With help from his pretty dream girl (Elaine Joyce), can the hapless patsy clear his name? Adding to the hilarity are co-stars Joe Flynn, Edward Andrews and Yvonne Craig.
link.title: synopsis
Now You See Him, Now You Don't
The Strongest Man in the World
The Apple Dumpling Gang Rides Again
The Horse in the Gray Flannel Suit
The Shakiest Gun in the West
Cats & Dogs: The Revenge of Kitty Galore

link.synopsis: Bob (Matt Damon) and Walt (Greg Kinnear) are joined at the hip ... literally. As conjoined twins, they do everything together, even though they're different in every way. Bob's a jock, and Walt's a show-off. Bob's shy with the ladies, but Walt gets them in bed in minutes. When Walt gets a chance at fame and fortune in Hollywood, Bob's right by his side, for better or worse. This Farrelly Brothers comedy co-stars Cher and Eva Mendes.
link.title: synopsis
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
City Slickers II: The Legend of Curly's Gold
The Nutty Professor II: The Klumps

link.synopsis: Baffled by a rash of high-stakes robberies, Wilson Heights district officials suspect a leak within the ranks of the local police department. Their solution: bring in Commandant Lassard (George Gaynes) and his band of blundering academy cohorts. Directed by Peter Bonerz, the sixth installment of this comedy franchise features a cast of familiar faces, including G.W. Bailey, Michael Winslow, Bubba Smith, David Graf and Leslie Easterbrook.
link.title: synopsis
Revenge of the Nerds 2: Nerds in Paradise
Revenge of the Nerds IV: Nerds in Love
The Fresh Prince of Bel Air
The Christmas Season Massacre / Satan Claus / Psycho Santa
The Longshot / They Went That-A-Way & That-A-Way

link.synopsis: This droll indie comedy follows a blissful young couple on the brink of getting married. But the bride-to-be, citing her lack of sexual experience, persuades her skeptical fiancé that they should both sleep around before the wedding.
link.title: synopsis
Me and You and Everyone We Know

link.synopsis: No less than Alfred Hitchcock takes a turn at the helm of this decidedly romantic comedy starring Robert Montgomery and Carole Lombard as the titular couple, David and Ann Smith. After three years of highs and lows in a mercurial nuptial, the two discover they aren't truly married after all. David hesitates sealing the deal for real, which drives Ann to the arms of the straight-laced Jeff (Gene Raymond). Is a happily-ever-after not meant to be?
link.title: synopsis
Alfred Hitchcock Shorts: Bon Voyage/ Aventure Malgache
The Doctor Takes a Wife / A Night to Remember
If You Could Only Cook / Too Many Husbands
I Was a Male War Bride

link.synopsis: In this pitch-black comedy from legendary writer-director Preston Sturges, Rex Harrison stars as Sir Alfred De Carter, a world-famous symphony conductor consumed with the suspicion that his wife's having an affair. During a concert, the jealous De Carter entertains elaborate visions of vengeance, set to three separate orchestral works. But when he attempts to put his murderous fantasies into action, nothing works out quite as planned.
link.title: synopsis
My Favorite Blonde / Star Spangled Rhythm
Anna and the King of Siam
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend

link.synopsis: This classic family comedy, adapted from the novel by Edward Streeter, follows the misadventures of harried city-dweller Roger Hobbs (James Stewart), who agrees to take his wife, Peggy (Maureen O'Hara), and their brood of children on vacation at the beach. But what begins as a relaxing escape quickly blossoms into a four-alarm nightmare, complete with a dilapidated summer rental that's practically falling down.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Wallace & Gromit: The Curse of the Were-Rabbit
VeggieTales: Silly Little Thing Called Love
Old Yeller / Savage Sam: Double Feature

link.synopsis: Shirley Temple tap dances with Bill "Bojangles" Robinson in this upbeat musical comedy inspired by Kate Wiggins's novel. Temple plays Rebecca Winstead, whose scheming stepfather, Harry (William Demarest), leaves her on a farm in the care of her aunt (Helen Westley). Rebecca thrives, but after a talent scout sees potential in the lass, the curly-topped cutie becomes a radio star overnight. Trouble crops up, though, when Harry comes to reclaim her.
link.title: synopsis
Shirley Temple: The Biggest Little Star
Laurel & Hardy: March of the Wooden Soldiers
A Hard Day's Night: Collector's Series
Dr. Seuss's The 5,000 Fingers of Dr. T

link.synopsis: In this urbane comedy of errors, Jack Lemmon (in a BAFTA-nominated performance) stars as happily married ad man Sam Bissel, who must pose as the husband of his wife's sexy friend in order to land a lucrative account with a prudish bigwig (Edward G. Robinson). Dorothy Provine and Romy Schneider co-star in this kooky double entendre-laden romp from director David Swift.
link.title: synopsis
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
The Wackiest Ship in the Army
A Guide for the Married Man
I Love You, Alice B. Toklas!
How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying

link.synopsis: Just when they think they're officially empty-nesters, Jack and Audrey Landry (John Larroquette and Karen Valentine) learn that their adult daughters (Kelly Overton, Marina Black and Jaime Ray Newman) are moving back home. While a full house is chaotic enough, things get even more frantic when the trio announces their engagements -- and plan their weddings for the same day in this made-for-TV comedy directed by Georg Stanford Brown.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: This laugh-out-loud sports comedy follows a motley squad of underdogs, led by slacker Artie DeVanzo (Artie Lange), who'd rather perfect their beer-drinking skills than concentrate on improving their softball game. But when the league threatens to banish them because of their attitude, underachiever Artie rallies his teammates and inspires them to new heights. The supporting cast includes Ralph Macchio, Seymour Cassel and Laurie Metcalf.
link.title: synopsis
Artie Lange: It's the Whiskey Talkin'
Balls Out: Gary the Tennis Coach
The Night of the White Pants
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down

link.synopsis: After gaining extraordinary powers from a radioactive explosion, Miami police officer Dave Speed (Terence Hill) struggles to master his superhero abilities in this cop comedy co-starring Ernest Borgnine. Dave's transformation disarms his grizzled partner, and his unpredictable talents lead to hilarious situations. Adding to the challenge: The bungling cop's new abilities vanish whenever he sees the color red.
link.title: synopsis
Tedeum / Revenge of Trinty / Viva Django / Blackie the Pirate
Between God, the Devil and a Winchester / Boot Hill
Trinity Goes East / Trinity and Bambino
The Longshot / They Went That-A-Way & That-A-Way
The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension

link.synopsis: Disguising herself as a man, Sylvia Scarlett (Katharine Hepburn) boards a ferry with her improvident father (Edmund Gwenn) to smuggle some expensive stolen lace and sell it for a handsome profit. But complications ensue when the duo hooks up with a rakish jewel thief (Cary Grant). This classic comedy is notable in part for a then-scandalous on-screen kiss between Hepburn and her female co-star, Dennie Moore.
link.title: synopsis
Thirty Day Princess / Kiss and Make Up
Wings in the Dark / Big Brown Eyes
Katharine Hepburn: On Her Own Terms
I Was a Male War Bride
I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
You Can't Take It with You

link.synopsis: David Zucker directs a star-studded cast in this topical comedy about an unpatriotic documentary filmmaker who wants to abolish the Fourth of July holiday -- until he's visited by three ghosts who beg him to reconsider. Can the spirits of America's past, present and future spark a change of heart? Kelsey Grammer, Jon Voight and Dennis Hopper star in this Charles Dickens–inspired fable that skewers the well-known work of director Michael Moore.
link.title: synopsis
Looking for Comedy in the Muslim World
Glick Doesn't Do Red Carpet: Jiminy Glick at the Independent Spirit Awards
Where in the World Is Osama Bin Laden?
Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America: A Final Night with George W. Bush
Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Movie

link.synopsis: A guys-only hunting weekend hits a snag when John's (Travis Aaron Wade) girlfriend, Brooks (Tina Huang), crashes the party -- and turns out to be the best shooter of the gang. But this annoyance is nothing compared to the insanity ahead. Fields of marijuana, crazed hicks, a hippie commune, a 3,000-pound killer boar and other high jinks combine in this unique and unpredictable horror comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Poultrygeist: Night of the Chicken Dead

link.synopsis: With a nod to the German hit Run Lola Run, this romantic comedy follows its own Lola (Ashleigh Sumner), a talented but scatterbrained photographer, as she attempts to make it to a key meeting on time. Three potential scenarios play out as Lola races against the clock. Both her job and her romance with fellow photographer Casey (Jill Bennett) rest on her ability to avoid distraction and demonstrate her responsibility. Cathy DeBuono co-stars.
link.title: synopsis
She Likes Girls 4: Tomboys & Tough Girls
Eating Out: All You Can Eat

link.synopsis: From the studio synonymous with good taste, the Asylum, comes this raunchy comedy about two wannabe Don Juans who have no luck with the ladies. That is, until the pair happens upon a stash of pot that the honeys find an irresistible turn-on. If breast-baring babes and killer weed are among your interests, then this sex- and smoke-filled romp is the film for you. Rollin Perry and Seth Adam Cassell star.
link.title: synopsis
American Pie Presents: The Naked Mile
Van Wilder 2: The Rise of Taj
National Lampoon's Ratko: The Dictator's Son

link.synopsis: Originally produced for Spike TV, this comedy special features UFC commentator and reality show host Joe Rogan as he takes the stage of The Southern Theatre in Columbus, Ohio, to offer his hilariously irreverent take on a wide variety of topics. Known for his fearlessness and brutal honesty, Rogan doesn't pull any punches as he tackles subjects such as evolution, fatherhood, marijuana use and Dr. Phil.
link.title: synopsis
Jim Jefferies: I Swear to God
Jim Breuer: Let's Clear the Air
Patton Oswalt: My Weakness Is Strong
American Drug War: The Last White Hope
Aziz Ansari: Intimate Moments for a Sensual Evening
Gabriel Iglesias: I'm Not Fat ... I'm Fluffy
The 41-Year-Old Virgin Who Knocked Up Sarah Marshall and Felt Superbad About It
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Over the Edge
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Jamie Foxx Presents: America's Funniest Comics: Vol. 4
Guy Torry's Phat Comedy Tuesdays: Vol. 2
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden

title.regular: Joe Rogan: Talking Monkeys in Space
title.short: Joe Rogan: Talking Monkeys in Space

link.synopsis: Fate throws a sucker punch at three unsuspecting brothers when their father kicks the bucket and they learn that his gambling and reckless ways have doomed them all to die. With just a few days of living left, they set out to try to make amends. But time's running out quickly. Harvey Keitel, J.K. Simmons, Scott Caan, Jason Jones and Tricia Helfer co-star in this quirky comedy from writer-director Jonathan Sobol.
link.title: synopsis
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story
The Year of Getting to Know Us
Big Mommas: Like Father, Like Son

link.synopsis: Sparks fly in this madcap comedy when beautiful but snobbish businesswoman Mihika finds herself forced to travel across India with the last man on earth she'd choose for a traveling companion -- a loud, gassy merchant named Manu.
link.title: synopsis
Once Upon a Time in Mumbai

link.synopsis: With the final installment of the long-running "Carry On" comedy film series from director Gerald Thomas and producer Peter Rogers, funnyman Jim Dale stars as the legendary explorer Christopher Columbus.
link.title: synopsis
The Zany Adventures of Robin Hood
Adolf Hitler: My Part in His Downfall
Christopher Columbus: Explorer of the New World
The Return of the Pink Panther

link.synopsis: Dorothy McNab (Elaine Stritch) is an American author residing in London with her decorous English butler Robert Hiller (Donald Sinden). The two have very uneven personalities and continually trade insults, mostly about the other's culture. But deep down, they're actually rather fond of one another. Included are episodes from the debut season of this 1970s British comedy series.
link.title: synopsis
The Boy Actor / Captain Coward / Sail Away
Not On Your Nellie: The Complete First Series
The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin: The Complete Series
Doctor Who: The Ark in Space

link.synopsis: Lovingly directed by his son Carl-Gustaf, Light Keeps Me Company offers an intimate and moving look at the life of the legendary Swedish cinematographer. Film clips, rare home movies, family photographs, and behind-the-scenes footage are interwoven with interviews featuring an array of film legends who've worked with him over the years.
link.title: synopsis
A Walk into the Sea: Danny Williams and the Warhol Factory
Visual Acoustics: The Modernism of Julius Shulman
Black White + Gray: A Portrait of Sam Wagstaff and Robert Mapplethorpe
An American Journey: In Robert Frank's Footsteps
Milton Glaser: To Inform and Delight
Who Is Harry Nilsson (And Why Is Everybody Talkin' About Him?)
The Girl Who Played with Fire
Picasso and Braque Go to the Movies

link.synopsis: Shirley MacLaine stars in this quirky comedy that also marks her directorial debut, the story of an unusually gifted boy named Bruno (Alex D. Linz) with a knack for spelling and a penchant for wearing dresses. As Bruno struggles to find acceptance from the kids at his Catholic school, he seeks the same approval from his father (Gary Sinise), who doesn't approve of his son's choices -- or the way his overweight mother (Stacey Halprin) is raising him.
link.title: synopsis
A Home at the End of the World

link.synopsis: A team of silver-haired softball players decides life's too short for second place, so they set out to win the World Series in this charming comedy. Faced with the prospect of rocking chairs and rest homes, the senior ball team changes its name from "Kids at Heart" to "Big Guns." The players embark on a raucous campaign involving ringers, non-regulation bats, women and booze. But is winning all it's cut out to be? Barry Primus and Mel Novak star.
link.title: synopsis
4192: The Crowning of the Hit King
American Pie Presents: The Naked Mile
